alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 02 at 11:29AM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches in western Siskiyou County above 2500 feet, and 8 to 15 inches in the Siskiyou Mountains and southern Oregon Cascades...except 3 to 6 inches on Siskiyou Summit. Winds will gust up to 30 mph. * WHERE...In California, Western Siskiyou County above 2500 feet west of the Scott Valley, including higher portions of Sawyers Bar Road. In Oregon, Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades including Lake of the Woods, portions of Highway 140, and higher portions of the Siskiyou Mountains. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional light snowfall is expected Monday afternoon into Tuesday evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades
